00001 /* TraceToEarth, Copyright (c) 1999 Michael G. Henderson <mghenderson@lanl.gov>
00002  *
00003  *    - Attempts to trace FL down to (some height above) the Earth.
00004  *     
00005  *
00006  *
00007  * Permission to use, copy, modify, distribute, and sell this software and its
00008  * documentation for any purpose is hereby granted without fee, provided that
00009  * the above copyright notice appear in all copies and that both that
00010  * copyright notice and this permission notice appear in supporting
00011  * documentation.  No representations are made about the suitability of this
00012  * software for any purpose.  It is provided "as is" without express or
00013  * implied warranty.
00014  *
00015  */
00016 
00017 #include <stdio.h>
00018 #include <stdlib.h>
00019 #include "Lgm/Lgm_MagModelInfo.h"
00020 
00021 
00022 
00023 int Lgm_TraceToEarth( Lgm_Vector *u, Lgm_Vector *v, double H0, double sgn, double tol, Lgm_MagModelInfo *Info ) {
00024 
00025     Lgm_Vector  u_scale;
00026     double      Htry, Htry_max, Hdid, Hnext, Hmin, Hmax, s;
00027     double      Sa=0.0, Sc=0.0, d;
00028     double      Rtarget, R, Fa, Fb, Fc, F;
00029     double      Ra, Rb, Rc;
00030     Lgm_Vector  Pa, Pc, P;
00031     int         done, reset;
00032     Pa.x = Pa.y = Pa.z = 0.0;
00033     Pc.x = Pc.y = Pc.z = 0.0;
00034     P.x = P.y = P.z = 0.0;
00035 
00036 
00037     if (Info->SavePoints) fprintf(Info->fp, "%f \t%f\t %f\t 3\n", u->x, u->y, u->z);
00038 
00039     /*
00040      *  H0 is in km above Earth's surface. Convert to geocentric
00041      *  radius.
00042      */
00043     Rtarget = H0/Re + 1.0;
00044 
00045 
00046 
00047     Hmax = Info->Hmax;
00048     Hmin = 0.001;
00049     u_scale.x =  100.0;  u_scale.y = 100.0; u_scale.z = 100.0;
00050     R = Ra = Rb = Rc = 0.0;
00051     F = Fa = Fb = Fc = 0.0;
00052 
00053 
00054     /*
00055      *   Add code to check to see if the start point is already below the target height.
00056      *   If it is, we can trace up until we are beyond it or some such thing...
00057      */
00058     done  = FALSE;
00059     reset = TRUE;
00060     P = *u;
00061     R = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00062     F = R - Rtarget;
00063     if (F <= 0.0 ){
00064         /* 
00065          *  We are already at or below target height.
00066          *  Trace until we are not.
00067          */
00068         Htry  = 0.1;
00069         while ( !done ) {
00070             Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, sgn, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00071             R = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00072             F = R - Rtarget;
00073             if ( F > 0.0 ){
00074                 done = TRUE;
00075             }
00076         }
00077 
00078     }
00079   
00080 
00081 
00082 
00083 
00084 
00085 
00086 
00087     /*
00088      *  Bracket the zero first. 
00089      *  We want to stop in the ionosphere which we represent as a sphere at a
00090      *  certain height above the Earth (we assume the Earth is a sphere not an
00091      *  oblate spheroid). We need to find 2 points along the field line such
00092      *  that the intersection of the FL with the sphere is guaranteed to lie
00093      *  between them.  To do this, we need to find three points; Pa and Pc such
00094      *  that;
00095      *  
00096      *           Pc > Pa
00097      *
00098      *      and  R( Pa ) - Rtarget   >   0.0
00099      *      and  R( Pc ) - Rtarget   <   0.0
00100      *
00101      *
00102      * 
00103      *  Set the start point, Pa and Fa. (Fa is Euclidean distance between sphere and
00104      *  point Pa.)
00105      *
00106      */
00107     Pa   = P;
00108     Ra   = Lgm_Magnitude( &Pa );
00109     Sa   = 0.0;
00110 
00111 
00112     /*
00113      *  Get an initial Htry that is safe -- i.e. start off slowly
00114      *  We dont really know where we are, so be conservative on the first try.
00115      *  If Lgm_MagStep() gives back an Hnext thats higher, we'll crank Htry up then...
00116      */
00117     Htry = 0.9*(Ra-1.0);        // This computes Htry as 90% of the distance to the Earth's surface (could be small if we are already close!)
00118     if (Htry > 0.1) Htry = 0.1; // If its bigger than 0.1 reset it to 0.1 -- to be safe.
00119     
00120 
00121 
00122     /*
00123      *  Keep stepping along the field line until we drop below the target
00124      *  radius, Rtarget.  (Or bail if its open). This completes the endpoints of the
00125      *  bracket pair. We get these points first, because there are field lines
00126      *  that have more than one local minimum in fabs(R-Rtarget). So find Pa and Pc
00127      *  first and then complete the triple later. CHECK on this. I changed this
00128      *  from a minima search to a simple root finder. Is it OK still?
00129      */
00130     P     = Pa;
00131     done  = FALSE;
00132     reset = TRUE;
00133     while ( !done ) {
00134 
00135         Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, sgn, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00136         R = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00137         F =  R - Rtarget;
00138         if ((F > 0.0) && (Info->SavePoints)) fprintf(Info->fp, "%f \t%f\t %f\t 2\n", P.x, P.y, P.z);
00139 
00140             if (   (P.x > Info->OpenLimit_xMax) || (P.x < Info->OpenLimit_xMin) || (P.y > Info->OpenLimit_yMax) || (P.y < Info->OpenLimit_yMin)
00141                 || (P.z > Info->OpenLimit_zMax) || (P.z < Info->OpenLimit_zMin) ) {
00142             /*
00143              *  Open FL!
00144              */
00145             v->x = v->y = v->z = 0.0;
00146             return(0);
00147         } else if ( F < 0.00 ) {
00148             done = TRUE;
00149             Pc = P;
00150             Rc = R;
00151             Fc = F;
00152             Sc += Hdid;
00153         } else {
00154             Pa = P;
00155             Fa = F;
00156             Ra = R;
00157             Sa = 0.0;
00158         }
00159 
00160         Htry = Hnext; // adaptively reset Htry
00161 
00162         /*
00163          *  Go no farther than some small distance below 
00164          *  the target Radius. Also respect Hmin and Hmax.
00165          */
00166         Htry_max = 0.9*fabs(R-1.0);
00167         if (Htry > Htry_max)  Htry = Htry_max;
00168         if      (Htry < Hmin) Htry = Hmin;
00169         else if (Htry > Hmax) Htry = Hmax;
00170 
00171 
00172     }
00173 
00174 
00175 
00176 
00177     /*
00178      *  We have a bracket. Now go in for the kill.
00179      *
00180      *  (Note: If all we wanted to know is whether or not the line hits the
00181      *  Earth, we could stop here: it must hit the Earth or we wouldnt
00182      *  have a minimum bracketed.)
00183      *
00184      *  Use golden-section search to converge toward minimum.
00185      *  (Sa, Sb, Sc) are the distances of the triple points along
00186      *  the FL. For convenience, we maintain Sa = 0.0, so that
00187      *  Sb and Sc are always the distances relative to Pa. (And
00188      *  so Sc is always the width of the bracketed interval. So when
00189      *  Sc gets small enough we bail out and take Pb as the min).
00190      *
00191      */
00192     done  = FALSE;
00193     reset = TRUE;
00194     while (!done) {
00195 
00196         d = Sc - Sa;
00197     
00198         if ( fabs(F) < tol ) {
00199             done = TRUE;
00200         } else {
00201 
00202             P = Pa; Htry = 0.5*d;
00203             Lgm_MagStep( &P, &u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, sgn, &s, &reset, Info->Bfield, Info );
00204             R = Lgm_Magnitude( &P );
00205             F =  R - Rtarget;
00206             if ( F >= 0.0 ) {
00207                 Pa = P; Fa = F; Sa += Hdid;
00208             } else {
00209                 Pc = P; Fc = F; Sc = Sa + Hdid;
00210             }
00211 
00212         }
00213     }
00214 
00215 
00216 
00217     /*
00218      *  Take average as the final answer.
00219      */
00220     v->x = 0.5*(Pa.x + Pc.x); v->y = 0.5*(Pa.y + Pc.y); v->z = 0.5*(Pa.z + Pc.z);
00221     if (Info->SavePoints) fprintf(Info->fp, "%f \t%f\t %f\t 2\n", v->x, v->y, v->z);
00222 
00223     return( 1 );
00224 
00225 }
00226 
00227 /*
00228  *   $id$
00229  */
